text:
How do you invoke a method (like a specific method, not a function)?
```julia> func(a) =5
func (generic function with 1 method)

julia> meth = first(methods(func))
func(a) in Main at REPL[83]:1

julia> meth(1)
ERROR: MethodError: objects of type Method are not callable
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ REPL[85]:1
 [2] eval
   @ .\boot.jl:360 [inlined]```

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-do-you-invoke-a-method-like-a-specific-method-not-a-function-julia-gt/54605|to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

Ah okay, or in that case also
```(first(meth.sig.parameters).instance)(5)```

elements.text: Ah okay, or in that case also

text: Right. Don't rely on that working though, it's not a public API
